title: Album Page, "Gate of Amsterdam at Haarlem, Inside View", August 27, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed:
recto, in graphite, bottom left: gate of Amsterdam / at Haarlem Aug 27th, 1887 / inside view;  at top right corner: (inscribed in a circle): 38; 34.

verso, in graphite, at center: Notes - in place of using lathes or fencework in partition / they use young bamboo or a sp... of it;  below: This building of smoky red brick / stone trimming - slate roof.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating a walkway that leads to a large, pointed arch opening in a massive masonry city gate.  Above the entrance is another pointed arch lancet window with four glazed panels. Rusticated quoins define the openings of both arches.  At the same height as this window are two turrets with octagonal domes and ball finials.  A clock is seen at the top of the façade, and behind it, the steeply  pitched roofs of the various towers on the other side of the gate.  The gate seems to straddle a water source, as the road rises in the center from the grass alongside, and a road or pathway is raised up on supports perpendicular to the gate.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Gate of Amsterdam at Haarlem, Inside View", August 27, 1887.
August 27, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-109.
